question.text:
Tom Arnold 11:55
Are you coming back to the office today?
Richard Hewitt 12:08
Yeah, 1 just finished that pitch to Anderson & Wright about the riverside restaurant.
Tom Arnold 12:13
Great. How did it go?
Richard Hewitt 12:13
I think they might bite.
Tom Arnold 12:13
Nice. It'd be great to have them in on this project.
Richard Hewitt 12:14
Exactly!
Tom Arnold 12:35
Can you join Harold and I for lunch at 1:00? At the Kettle Room?
Richard Hewitt 12:35
Sure. I'll have the cab change directions and meet you there.
Tom Arnold  12:39
Good. See you soon.
What is suggested about Mr. Hewitt?
choices: (A) He is late for a lunch appointment
(B) He has accepted a new position.
(D) He is on his way to a presentation

answer.explanation: Derived from the message "I'll have the cab change directions"

question.text: At 12:14, what does Mr. Hewitt mean when he writes, “Exactly!”?
choices: (A) He would like to know where they’re having lunch.
(B) He is looking forward to meeting Anderson & Wright.
(C) He is on his way back to the office.
(D) He would also like Anderson & Wright to join the project.

answer.text: (D) He would also like Anderson & Wright to join the project.
answer.explanation: In the message just before, Tom Arnold said “It'd be great to have them in on this project” (It would be nice to have them in our project). So when Hewwit says 'Exactly' he agrees with this.

Transcript: W1: Hi, can I please speak with Thomas Hyatt? It’s regarding the construction at Franklin’s Studios. He’s the fund manager, right?
W2: Yes. Can I ask who’s calling?
W: This is Sharon Jasmin, the studio director at Franklin’s Studios. We are upgrading our studios but we’re supposed to receive some funding today that didn’t go through. The builders have stopped construction until I can guarantee payment.
W2: OK, I’ll put you through to Mr. Hyatt now. Hold please.
W1: Thank you.
M: Hello? Mrs. Jasmin?
W1: Good morning, Mr. Hyatt. Are those funds coming through today? I really want to stay on target with our project so we need to keep construction going.
M: Definitely. I’m actually at the bank now doing all the transfers so the money should be in your account within half an hour. I’ll send you a confirmation receipt via cell phone; please message me back when you get it.

question.text: Who is Mr. Hyatt?
What problem does Mrs. Jasmin mention?
What does Mr. Hyatt ask Mrs. Jasmin to do?

As I'm sure you're aware, this week we must decide if we want to continue working with cc Wheel Delivery. After yesterday's meeting, it's clear that they are being sued for the accident that happened last week. - [1] - We all agreed that the whole company shouldn't be liable for the mistakes of a few careless workers. But, that was a conversation we had before we had really thought about the ramifications of our decision. - [2] - Unfortunately, the situation is escalating and there is about to be a lot of bad press. - [3] - It's true that many of them are our friends. But, we must protect our company. We can't handle anything that could alter our sales. For the last four months, we've been operating with a very thin margin for error. If our sales drop even the slightest, it could be detrimental. So, I'm suggesting that, as a means of protecting ourselves from any negative backlash, we cut our ties with cc Wheel Delivery. Maybe later, if they're able to rehabilitate their name, we'll work with them again. - [4] - I propose we vote one more time on whether or not to work with them.
What is indicated about the company that the speaker works for?

answer.explanation: Information lies in two sentences “For the last four months, we've been operating with a very thin margin for error. If our sales drop even the slightest, it could be detrimental

question.text:
In which of the marked positions [1], [2], [3], or [4] does this sentence best belong?
“Yes, we’ve worked with them for a long time”

answer.explanation:
"Yes, we have been working with them for a long time"
We see the sentence after position [3] has the same content as "It's true that many of them are our friends" ( It is true that a lot of them are our friends).
So, these 2 sentences are giving objective information about the relationship between the two companies, but then conclude that it is still necessary to stop cooperating.

question.text: Why does the man wish to stop working with cc Wheel Delivery?
choices: (A) To protect his company from financial damage
(B) To cut production costs over the next four months
(C) To lower the price of an individual product
(D) To avoid legal trouble in the future

answer.text: (A) To protect his company from financial damage
answer.explanation: Information lies in the sentence “So, I'm suggesting that, as a means of protecting ourselves from any negative backlash, we cut our ties with CC Wheel Delivery

question.text: What is true about cc Wheel Delivery?
choices: (A) A contract of theirs has just been canceled.
(B) Legal action is being taken against them.
(C) The president of cc Wheel Delivery has stepped down.
(D) Two of their trucks were in an accident.

answer.text: (B) Legal action is being taken against them.
answer.explanation: Can be inferred from 2nd sentence “they are being sued for the accident that happened last week”

Transcript: M: Here is the restaurant space I told you about last week. I think it’s perfect for a small café. There is also a patio area out the back. You can see it from here.
W: Oh yeah, that look’s nice. I think this is a little small but I like the location.
M: It is small, but with the patio space you could probably seat 20 people.
W: I’ve looked at another location up the street that is about 10% cheaper than this, so it’s a tough choice.
M: I see. Well, we can negotiate on the price. I’ll just have to talk to my manager first.
W: That would be great. If you can match their rental cost I would probably take this location because of the patio.
M: OK. Let me talk to my manager and get back to you.

question.text: What does the woman say about the restaurant space?
choices: (D) It’s a bit far from her office.

question.text: Why does the woman say “I’ve looked at another location up the street that is about 10% cheaper”?
choices: (A) To get a lower rental cost

answer.text: (A) To get a lower rental cost

question.text: What does the man say about the price?
choices: (B) He has to ask his co-worker.
(C) He has to ask his manager.

answer.text: (C) He has to ask his manager.

question.text: The buzz at New York’s premier book fair is all about the upcoming book from poet-turned- novelist Harry s. Tepper. The Nightingales of Fall is the eagerly awaited sequel to his best¬selling debut novel, The Swallows of spring. The book follows the journey of Sally Harknett through the weird world of Underfell, mixing social commentary with sharp wit and just a dash of magic and mystery. Tepper burst onto the scene over a decade ago with the acclaimed poetry collection, King Harmon’s Castle, and the expectation for this latest novel is another chart-topping success. Later this week, the first editions will be made available in a prize drawing at the New York Book Fair, with the official launch at major bookstores next month.
Where are copies available this week?
How would Mr. Tepper’s latest book most likely be classified?

September 21—What is the secret to delicious home-cooked meals? Kimberly Lee, host of the My Home Cooking television show and owner of her own restaurant chain, seems to know all the secrets. Her show has been on the air for over two years, and now she has a devoted group of followers around the country. When she sat down for an interview with US, she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food.
Ms. Lee is scheduled to publish her very first cookbook near the end of the month. The book is entitled Kimberly Lee’s My Home Cooking, and it provides easy-to- follow recipes that can be made in less than 30 minutes. Over 40,000 copies have already been pre-ordered so far.
Ms. Lee says that the final page of the book will include a detachable fan club membership form. Those who fill the form out and send it in to the provided address will receive a monthly newsletter and exclusive recipes available only to those in the fan club. Fan club members will also receive a password that allows access to a fan club website.

===========================

To: Kimberly Lee-kimberlylee@kimberlylee.com
From: Suzie Sanders - suziesanders@kimberlylee.com
Date: October 12
Subject: Update

Dear Ms. Lee,
Great news! I’m happy to report that not only has your book been selling well, but the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I’m certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book.
Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month’s newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time.
Sincerely,

Suzie Sanders Publicity
Coordinator
What is the first thing to do in order to become a fan club member?

answer.explanation: At the end of the article she Lee says the last page of the book has a membership registration form. So to be able to get the registration form, the first thing to do is to buy that book.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the article?
choices: (B) To provide advice for professional chefs

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the main content of the article is about Ms. Lee and her upcoming book. So the correct answer is A.

question.text: What is suggested about next month’s newsletter?
choices: (A) It will be mailed behind schedule.
(B) It will feature a column about healthy eating habits.
(C) It will contain an article on desserts.
(D) It will include a copy of Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It will contain an article on desserts.
answer.explanation:
Derived from the last two sentences of the letter: “Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month's newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time. ”
So if they meet the members' request, next month's letter will have recipes for desserts like cakes and candies.

question.text: In the e-mail, what does Suzie Sanders say about the article?
choices: (A) It was written by a famous journalist.
(B) It was featured on a popular cooking website.
(C) It helped increase fan club membership.
(D) It contained excerpts from Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It helped increase fan club membership.
answer.explanation: The information at the beginning of the email: “the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I'm certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book. ”

question.text: Accordingto Ms. Lee, what is the secret to successful cooking?

answer.explanation: Information in the following sentence in the article “she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food”

Transcript: W: Hi, Matthew. Any news on our sales results for last month?
M: I am just finishing the report now. Looks like our sales are booming in our Woodsdale stores, but the Collingwood stores aren’t doing well. Usually it’s the other way around.
W: Hmm... That’s interesting.
M: Maybe we need to take a trip to Collingwood and talk to the management team about why their sales changed so quickly.
W: Yep. Let’s go this afternoon.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
What does the woman imply when she says “That’s interesting”?
choices: (A) She wants to work at the Collingwood store.
(B) She knows their sales are down.
(C) She wasn’t listening to the man.
(D) She wants to know why the sales are down.

answer.text: (D) She wants to know why the sales are down.

question.text: What does the man suggest they do?

From: Stacey Watkins (staceywatkins@titus.com)
To: Ann Rose (annrose@putkincomp.com)
Subject: Conference of Bank Managers
Date: February 12

Dear Ms. Rose,
You recently contacted US about using our conference center again this year to host your Annual Conference of Bank Managers. This year we have updated our conference room with new projectors and more comfortable seating. We will be providing shuttle busses from the airport and a premium buffet in the dining hall as well as an Internet café where guests can use computers or print documents at no cost. For your convenience, we will also be providing useful supplies such as flip charts, 10-foot whiteboards, and projector screens.
Once you decide on a date, we ask that you please make a down payment of $1,000 after we see if it is available. The remaining balance should be paid upon your arrival. Also, we ask that as the organizer of the event, you arrive at the conference center a day before the conference begins. This way, any unforeseen circumstances can be taken care of beforehand.
We appreciate your business with the Titus Conference Center again. We are looking forward to providing you with the best service possible.

Stacey Watkins,
Director

===========================

From:Ann Rose (annrose@putkincomp.com)
To: Stacey Watkins (staceywatkins@titus.com)
Subject: RE: Conference of Bank Managers
Date: February 16

Dear Mr. Watkins,
I am also pleased to be working with you again this year. We would like to reserve your conference space for the weekend of August 15 to 16. Additionally, the down payment will be handled by our financial department. I will have one of the employees contact you soon.
There is one thing that I would like to tell you. Actually, last year, some of our attendees were disappointed because the dining hall didn’t offer a variety of vegetarian options. I hope this inconvenience will be dealt with in advance this year.

Thank you,
Ann Rose
Organizer, Annual Conference of Bank Managers
What does Ms. Rose suggest about the Titus Conference Center?
choices: (A) It will be their first time working together.
(C) It has several locations in the country.
(D) It failed to satisfy some guests last year.

answer.text: (D) It failed to satisfy some guests last year.
answer.explanation: The information in the second sentence near the end of the second email "Actually, last year, some of our attendees were disappointed because the dining hall didn't offer a variety of vegetarian options"

question.text: What is indicated about the Titus Conference Center?
choices: (B) It demands full payment at the time of reservation.
(C) It is located next to an international airport.
(D) It currently has no vacancies for the month.

answer.explanation: Information is in the second sentence of the first email “This year we have updated our conference room with new projectors and more comfortable seating”

question.text: When will Ms. Rose most likely arrive at the Titus Conference Center?

answer.explanation: On 2nd email, Ms. Rose wrote that “We would like to reserve your conference space for the weekend of August 15 to 16”. However, in the first email it was stated that “we are asking that, as the organizer of the event, you must come to the convention center one day before the conference begins. “

question.text: What is NOT mentioned as a benefit of using the Titus Conference Center?

answer.explanation: Third sentence in email the first said “We will be providing shuttle busses from the airport and a premium buffet in the dining hall”. That way they will provide only one meal, not multiple meals.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the second e-mail?
choices: (A) To reserve tickets for an upcoming conference
(B) To request help in making a payment

answer.explanation: The second email is from Ms. Rose, which confirms the date of the reservation at the center and provides information about the payment. So the main purpose of this email is to confirm the reservation of the Titus Convention Center accommodation.

Transcript: M1: Harry, Anne, what kind of tools did you say we need?
M2: Look over there in the hardware section. We need a drill, and two hammers. We don’t need anything else because I’m getting all the small equipment delivered to the office today.
W: What about paint?
M2: We don’t need paint; we already have it.
M1: OK. But we do need some nails. I know you didn’t order those. I saw the invoice.
M2: Yes, you’re right. Let’s get what we need here and then go.

question.text: Where most likely are the speakers?
What does the man mention about the delivery?
choices: (A) He isn’t getting any equipment delivered to the office.
(B) He is getting the small equipment delivered to the office.
(C) He is getting a drill delivered to the office.
(D) He is getting some documents delivered to the office.

answer.text: (B) He is getting the small equipment delivered to the office.

question.text: What does the man say he needs?

To: John Masterson (jmasterson@masterstrokeindustries.com)
From: Carl Ennens (cennens@gmail.com)
Date: December 30
Subject: Internship

Dear Mr. Masterson,
My name is Carl Ennens and I am entering my final year at Evergreen state College. I am majoring in industrial engineering here, and my liquid dynamics professor, Dr. Alcobar, recommended Master stroke Industries as a possible internship opportunity. Your company is recognized as a leader in flow research. If you would be willing to accept an intern for the coming spring semester, I could give you up to 15 hours per week of work, provided that you are able to write some performance evaluations that I could turn in to Dr. Alcobar for credit. Thank you for your consideration, and if you would like to see my transcript, I would be happy to forward it to you.
All the best, Carl Ennens

==========================

To: Carl Ennens (cennens@gmail.com)
From: John Masterson (jmasterson@masterstrokeindustries.com)
Date: December 31
Subject: Internship

Dear Carl Ennens,
I appreciate your interest in interning with US here at Master Stroke Industries. We have not accepted a lot of interns in the past, but I know Dr. Alcobar personally, and if he recommended that you contact US, he must have faith in your ability. I think we should set up an interview at our headquarters downtown on Holly street. We can get to know each other a bit over some coffee and I will show you around our facilities. Don't worry about your transcripts; like I said, if Dr. Alcobar thinks you’ll be a good fit, I’ll trust his judgment. How about this coming Friday at 10 A.M.?

Look forward to meeting you Carl,
John Masterson
CEO, Master stroke Industries

==========================

Memorandum To Master stroke Industry Employees


This spring, at Master stroke Industries, we will have an intern assisting US with everything from making coffee to solving complex equations. Carl Ennens is a student here at the University and has kindly offered his services in exchange for a piece of our operational knowledge. Please treat him with respect and don’t be afraid to use him for an extra pair of hands, eyes, or opinion should you need it. And I did hear he makes a good cup of coffee!
What is indicated about Dr. Alcobar?
choices: (B) People do not appreciate his opinion.
(C) He is respected by John Masterson.
(D) He has done a lot of prominent research.

answer.text: (C) He is respected by John Masterson.
answer.explanation: You can infer from John Masterson's attitude in the second email: “if Dr. Alcobar thinks you'll be a good fit, I'll trust his judgment ”

question.text: Accordingto the memorandum, what will Carl Ennens be expected to do?

answer.explanation:
In the memo there is says Carl will do a lot of kinds of things “assisting us with everything from making coffee to solving complex equations” (assisting everything from making coffee to solving complex calculations)
“use him for an extra pair of hands, eyes, or opinion should you need it ”

question.text: In the second e-mail, the term “headquarters” in the fourth line is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: What is indicated about Carl Ennens?
choices: (A) He is a senior in high school.
(B) He is a junior in college.
(C) He will graduate in two years.
(D) He is a senior in college.

answer.text: (D) He is a senior in college.
answer.explanation: Information in first sentence of first email “My name is Carl Ennens and I am entering my final year at Evergreen State College”

question.text: What position does John Masterson have in the company?

answer.explanation: Carl writes a letter to John Masteron to apply for an internship, so this should be someone in the role of human resource operator or general manager. Thus, answer A is the most suitable.

question.text:
To: Bill Johnson (bj@action.net)
From: Laurie Wheeler (lwheeler@zipnet.com)
Date: October 11
Subject: Reservation Info

Dear Mr. Johnson,
I am writing you on behalf of the company I work for, Competitive Excellence. We work with productivity and efficiency training for corporations and small businesses. Lately, our staff has been suffering from low morale, and while searching the Internet for solutions, I came across your website www.action.net. I am interested in hearing more about the motivational speaking that you do. Specifically, could you tell me if your speeches are religious in nature? We have a diverse staff and I am looking for something that is secular. Please write me back with an overview of what you do and what your rates are for a presentation.
Laurie Wheeler,
Managing Director, Competitive Excellence

==========================

To: Laurie Wheeler (lwheeler@zipnet.com)
From: Bill Johnson (bj@action.net)
Date: October 13
Subject: Reservation Info

Dear Ms. Wheeler,
Thank you so much for your interest in Action. I am happy to answer your questions and provide you with a full breakdown of what we can do for you, your team, and your company. To begin with, all of our talks are secular, though not necessarily free from the concept of spirituality. Our professional speakers seek to motivate people to look internally to find their own spirit and help it rise. Morale, after all, is an intangible but essential aspect of an effective team. Please refer to the topic list and pricing guide I have attached to this e-mail. Once you have found a theme, speaker, and chosen the appropriate class size for your company, please send me a follow-up e-mail to schedule your event.
Bill Johnson,
Action Coordinator

=========================
 
STARGATE CONVENTION CENTER SCHEDULE OF EVENTS
 
Theme Location Speaker Class Size Duration Price
Stay in the Moment! On Site Jim Grey 15-20 3 hours $450
New You Everyday Off Site Darlene 20-25 3 hours $400
Stay Positive for the Team! Off Site Jeff Boxer 15-30 3 hours $400
Blessed are We All Off Site John Brown 20-30 4 hours $500
What course will Laurie Wheeler likely sign up for?

answer.explanation: In the first email she said her employees are being “low morale”, then “Stay positive for the team ”will be a suitable choice to improve team morale.

question.text: What is indicated about Action?
choices: (A) They do not promote a religion.
(C) They are just building their brand.
(D) They are moving to a new location.

answer.text: (A) They do not promote a religion.
answer.explanation: In the second email it says "while searching the Internet for solutions, I came across your website www.action.net."

question.text: What is indicated about Competitive Excellence?
choices: (A) They are struggling with employee sales.
(B) The mood in the office is not good
(C) They are having a booming year of sales
(D) They want to try to change their business focus.

answer.text: (B) The mood in the office is not good
answer.explanation: From the very first email of Ms. Laurie Wheeler: “Lately, our staff has been suffering from low morale”

question.text: How did Laurie Wheeler learn about Action?

answer.explanation: Information in place “while searching the Internet for solutions, I came across your website www.action.net.

question.text: Accordingto the graphic, what is NOT mentioned as an option for customers?

answer.explanation: Items found in the table are only items of the lesson, time, and place, not mentioning the number of people in the class.

question.text: @PS@/kstoeic/images/3770262_1564545937709.png@PE@

answer.explanation:
Transcript: M: Hi Sally, how has your day been?
W: Really great Jim, I have been busy, but productive. How was your meeting this morning?
M: It went better than I expected. The interior design specialist just gave us some recommendations for our office layout. We don't need to purchase anything new, just rearrange a few things.
W: Oh really? What did he say?
M: He suggested that we move the help desk and the sales desk so that they are on opposite sides of the entrance. That way, if we have people waiting in line they won’t be crowded. We will just slide the sales desk to where the waiting area is now.
W: That is a good idea, and this way, when people come into the office they can see all of our products displayed against the back wall.
M: Exactly, and then after they purchase their items they can just step out the door. Glad we are already on the same page.
W: Well, I think we should start moving the sales desk right away, don’t you?

question.text: What did the man recently do?
choices: (B) He met with a sales associate.
(C) He met with an interior decorator.

answer.text: (C) He met with an interior decorator.

question.text: Why does the man want to move the sales desk?
choices: (C) To make more room for the woman to work
(D) To give waiting customers more space

answer.text: (D) To give waiting customers more space

question.text: Look at the graphic. Where will the sales desk be moved to?
choices: (A) Where the help desk is now.
(B) So it is to the right of the entrance.
(D) They will move the help desk instead.

question.text:
Brand-X Coming to Town

March 9 - Popular Danish skincare company Brand-X is finally launching their best-selling line in America. The 88-year-old company has been Denmark's leading skincare brand and the top selling cream, Xtreme 7, has been Europe's most popular facial cream for over 10 years. Though Americans may not have had access to these creams before, the brand is already generating much excitement. Dermatologist Dr. Francis Keenan explains, "Tests have shown that Xtreme 7 dramatically reduces the fine lines around the eye area and laugh lines after only 30 days of use, but the price of the cream is only a fraction of what department store brands sell for. I'll definitely recommend this cream to my clients."
"People have been asking about Xtreme 7 but the products haven't even arrived yet!" added Susan Chan, an employee at a beauty counter. "People are already calling in to pre-order."
A spokesperson for the company explained that Brand-X is making moves to expand into the North American and Asian markets. For now, only the best-selling line will be available sometime next month, outside of Europe, but within a year, more products will be available

==========================

Brand-X Positions at American Headquarters in Westminster, California

Don’t miss your chance to work in an exciting career in skincare and beauty with Brand-X. 80 administrative and customer service positions will be available regardless of experience. Applicants need to have good communication skills, bilingual ability in both English and Spanish is preferred but not necessary, and knowledge in computer use is a must. Applicants with experience in cosmetics, dermatology, or marketing will get a chance to work in several management positions for Brand-X. Please visit our website at www.brandx.com/jobs for more information. You can fill out the application forms and send them in before March 20th. Interviews will take place at Hillway Building on 143 Garden Road. Be sure to bring your resumes and reference letters.

===========================

To: Professor David Mills
From: Jacqueline O’Hare
Date: March 28
Subject: Job

Dear Professor Mills,
Thank you so much for the reference letter you supplied me with. I was recently hired by Brand-X and I begin my orientations next week Wednesday at 10:00 A.M. However, we have our statistics test at that time. Is there any way that I can take a make-up test at a different time or hand in another assignment as a replacement for the test? I would hate to miss the orientations which are mandatory and I don't want to disappoint my new employers. The job should not have any other impact on my school work otherwise. I kindly appreciate your consideration in this.
Sincerely,
Jacqueline O’Hare
What is suggested about Brand-X?
choices: (A) Products are currently only available in Europe.
(B) It is Europe’s most popular brand.
(C) It is a luxury skincare company.
(D) The company was first launched 10 years ago.

answer.text: (A) Products are currently only available in Europe.
answer.explanation:
From the last sentence of the article “For now, only the best-selling line will be available sometime next month, outside of Europe, but within a year, more products will be available. ”
Sold outside of Europe, so it can be inferred that the products are currently only available in Europe.

question.text: What is indicated in the advertisement?
choices: (A) All positions don’t require previous work experience.
(C) Experience in certain fields can lead to management positions.
(D) The available positions are only temporary.

answer.text: (C) Experience in certain fields can lead to management positions.
answer.explanation: The information contained in the phrase “Applicants with experience in cosmetics, dermatology, or marketing will get a chance to work in several management positions for Brand-X”

question.text: Accordingto the article, what does Brand-X plan to do?

answer.explanation: The information is in the first sentence of the last paragraph of the article “A spokesperson for the company explained that Brand-X is making moves to expand into the North American and Asian market”

question.text: What does Dr. Keenan suggest about xtreme 7?
choices: (A) It is the most effective cream on the market.
(B) It is worth the high price tag.
(C) It is both effective and cheap.
(D) It is the only cream that doctors would recommend.

answer.text: (C) It is both effective and cheap.
answer.explanation:
You can infer from the sentence “Dermatologist Dr. Francis Keenan explains, “Tests have shown that Xtreme 7 reduces the fine lines around the eye area and laugh lines after only 30 days of use, but the price of the cream is only a fraction of what department store brands sell for”

So this product is efficient and its price is not as expensive as the other brands.

question.text: For what position was Jacqueline most likely hired?

answer.explanation: From email, it can be inferred that Ms. Jacqueline is still born. tablets. So she didn't have any experience in marketing or dermatology yet so she couldn't work as a manager. In addition, the vacancies are only administrative and customer service, so the position that Ms. Jacqueline is recruited will be customer service.
